Nash Equilibria in Symmetric Games
Nash equilibria in symmetric games
Every (strongly) symmetric game has a symmetric equilibrium (Nash, 1951)
Symmetric equilibrium can be computed in P if |A| = O(log |N|/ log log |N|) (Papadimitriou and Roughgarden, 2005)
Does not apply to pure equilibria or weak symmetry
Not obvious that symmetry simplifies the search for equilibria
